main event: On December 31, 1961, an unidentified object was observed visually and on radar in Dayton, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was stationary and then accelerated out of sight after hovering for about 25 minutes., Witnesses initially thought the object was a bright star due to its apparent brightness., The object was circular in shape, approximately 50-60 feet in diameter, and silver in color., The sighting was reported by a civilian and evaluated for further analysis due to its unusual characteristics., All witnesses provided consistent statements about the object's appearance and behavior.
